intro: Flagenium kamerunense, commonly known as the Cameroon flagellum, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, whip-like stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
